title: Unable to install League of Legends on new Windows 10 Laptop
body: Whenever I try to install the client I get a Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 Redistributable error. I've had a look at other threads and tried what other people have recommended but nothing seems to work.

replies.body: I just reinstalled windows 10 because of a serious crash and now can't install league - same issue of C++ not installing. I have tried the below and neither worked...HELP!
I'm having same problem, didn't work for me, help?

Hey there,

Could you please provide us with the exact error you're receiving?
https://imgur.com/SoA2vHz That is the error I've been getting. I got the same error when trying to reinstall Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 redistributable.
Could you please open event viewer (WinKey + r and then type eventvwr) locate the error and paste the details here.
I can't find anything about Error 1935. I'm also fairly new to Windows so I won't fully understand anything too technical.

Could you try the following and let me know if that helps

* Open an Administrative command prompt (Right click on the start button, command prompt (admin)).
* Run the following command (This assumes your installation of windows is located on Drive C:, if this is not the case please change the drive letter mentioned.

>fsutil resource setautoreset true C:\

* Reboot the machine.
* Attempt to reinstall league.

If the above doesn't help please try [performing a clean boot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes#wq7) and then attempting to install league.
I did a clean boot and LoL installed just fine. Thanks for the suggestion!
No problem, glad I was able to resolve your issue :)
I have tried all of this on a new laptop, with no success. Please help me
